slides.title: What is Renewable Energy?
slides.content:
# Free Refills üîÑ

Energy from sources that replenish naturally.
- Sun, Wind, Water, Earth Heat.
- Unlimited supply.
- Usually Low Carbon.

slides.title: Solar Energy (PV)
slides.content:
# Sun Power ‚òÄÔ∏è

**Photovoltaics**: Converting light directly to electricity.
- Silicon panels.
- Cost has dropped 90% in 10 years.
- Works best in sunny places, but works everywhere.

slides.title: Concentrated Solar Power (CSP)
slides.content:
# Mirrors ü™û

Focusing sunlight to heat salt/water $\to$ Steam $\to$ Turbine.
- Can store heat to produce power at night.
- Used in deserts.

slides.title: Wind Energy
slides.content:
# Spinning Giants üå¨Ô∏è

Turbines capture kinetic energy of air.
- **Onshore**: Cheaper.
- **Offshore**: Stronger/consistent winds, but expensive.
- Bigger blades = More power.

slides.title: Hydropower
slides.content:
# Water Power üíß

Dams.
- Gravity pulls water through turbine.
- Provides "Baseload" (constant) power.
- Environmental issue: Blocks fish migration.

slides.title: Solar Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Photovoltaic cells convert sunlight directly into:

slides.title: Geothermal
slides.content:
# Earth Heat üåã

Tapping heat from crust.
- Iceland runs on this.
- Clean, constant, reliable.
- Limited to volcanic areas usually.

slides.title: Biomass / Biofuels
slides.content:
# Burning Plants üåΩ

- **Ethanol**: Corn/Sugarcane alcohol (in your car gas).
- **Biogas**: Methane from rotting waste.
- Carbon Neutral? (Plants absorbed CO2 while growing, burning releases it back).

slides.title: Tidal and Wave Energy
slides.content:
# Moon Power üåä

- **Tidal**: Underwater turbines driven by tides (Reliable).
- **Wave**: Bobbing buoys capturing motion.
- Harsh saltwater environment makes maintenance hard.

slides.title: Intermittency Problem
slides.content:
# Sun doesn't shine at night üåô

The main challenge.
- Need **Storage** (Batteries) or **Baseload** backup.
- Grid must be smarter to handle fluctuating power.

slides.title: Energy Storage
slides.content:
# Batteries üîã

- **Lithium-Ion**: Phones, Cars, Grid.
- **Pumped Hydro**: Pumping water uphill when extra power, letting it flow down when needed (Biggest battery on Earth).
- **Green Hydrogen**: Storing energy as gas.

slides.title: Nuclear Energy
slides.content:
# The Controversial Cousin ‚ò¢Ô∏è

- Not strictly "Renewable" (Uranium runs out).
- But **Carbon Free**.
- Massive power density.
- Dangerous waste and accident risk (Chernobyl/Fukushima).

slides.title: Hydrogen Economy
slides.content:
# Fuel of Future? üíß

Splitting water ($H_2O$) into $H_2$ and $O_2$.
- **Green Hydrogen**: Uses solar/wind.
- Clean burning (Waste is water).
- Good for steel, shipping, and planes.

slides.title: Storage Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is currently the most common form of grid-scale energy storage?

slides.title: Smart Grid
slides.content:
# Intelligent Network üß†

Digital communication used on power lines.
- Detecting outages instantly.
- Balancing local solar (your roof) with grid demand.
- Charging EVs when power is cheap.

slides.title: Energy Efficiency
slides.content:
# Fifth Fuel üìâ

The best energy is the energy you don't use.
- LED lights (Use 90% less).
- Insulation.
- Efficient motors.

slides.title: Fusion
slides.content:
# Star Power ‚≠ê

Smashed atoms together (H + H $\to$ He).
- Same as Sun.
- Infinite clean energy, no meltdown risk.
- "Always 30 years away" (Hard to do).

slides.title: Electrification
slides.content:
# Plug Everything In üîå

Decarbonizing society means electrifying everything.
- Cars (EVs).
- Heating (Heat Pumps).
- Cooking (Induction).

slides.title: Renewable Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Sun and Wind are now cheapest energy.
- **Storage** is the key.
- Transition is happening fast.
- The future is electric.
